snippet: More than 170 countries — but few top leaders of global powers — will attend a gathering organized by the United Nations, the first of its kind, starting Monday in Istanbul.
abstract: United Nations plans its first World Humanitarian Summit, in Istanbul, to discuss its humanitarian aid system, which has come under widespread criticism by aid workers who say they are underfunded and that archaic system is placing them in increasing danger; while 170 countries will be represented, some of world's most powerful leaders, including Pres Obama and Pres Vladimir V Putin, will not attend.
lead_paragraph: More than 170 countries — but few top leaders of global powers — will attend a gathering organized by the United Nations, the first of its kind, starting Monday in Istanbul.

headline.main: Thin on Influence, World Humanitarian Summit Will Tackle Aid Crisis
headline.print_headline: Thin on Influence, U.N.’s First Global Aid Gathering Will Tackle Aid Crisis
